instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..
definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>/<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> tcon replacment
threads.message:
Hello, got <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> in with display issue:

Cold start with no image but backlight is on, if you leave the machine on, after some time you start to see the image: it start to appear with a lot of horizontal lines and after some time ( i presume when tcon heat up) the image is almost good (just couple, not very noticeable horizontal lines left on top)

I presume the issue is with tcon, will test it with another lcd to confirm, but the question is:

Is it possible to change the chip or maybe the whole tcon board from another lcd? Was not able to find any information on that one

Thank you!

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>/<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> tcon replacment
threads.message:
Ok, with a test screen all is working as expected
Definitely a problem with tcon board
